did.unittitle: William Bartram meteorological diary, January 1, 1790 - September 13, 1791
did.abstract: These are daily observations of temperature, humidity, wind, and precipitation kept by Bartram in Philadelphia. He also notes such occurrences as "River [Schuylkill] froze over" (February 7, 1790).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Forms part of the Benjamin Smith Barton Papers.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Naturalist William Bartram traveled throughout the southern frontier collecting seeds and specimens and making botanical drawings.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Purchased from John W. Delafield, Montgomery Place, NY, and accessioned, 1970 (1970 1013ms).

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This item is also available on microfilm (Film 1467, Reel 2).

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: The William Bartram meteorological diary is part of the Barton collection. It is a small journal that contains weather records for Philadelphia, 1790-1791.
